page.title: 14PHYSICAL LANDSCAPE
page.content: The{Aeron Valley}runs inland from Aberaeron in an E-SE direction.The {River Aeron}meanders across the flat flood plain of the valley which has {steep wooded sides.} These steep slopes are wooded because they are not suitable for agriculture.The valley floor and plateau at a height of {300-400feet}are farmed by mainly beef and dairy farms. The{coastline}has many{sandy beaches and{coves,}but Aberaeron has a pebble beach. The{cliffs}on the south are old steep,old,and over 200ft in place.From Aberaeron to Aberarth, the old cliffs now only 50 ft high are covered by boulder clay. These cliffs crumble and erode easily. The gradient up to the school is approximately 1 in 5, a very steep climb especially if its raining, snowy or covered in ice.
